member.name: T:Kentico.Web.Mvc.Internal.BaseRouteConstraint
member.summary: Base class for defining route constraints that must be implemented in order to check whether a URL parameter value is valid for a constraint. Class provides overridable method that is framework agnostic and servers to help avoid dealing with framework specific code when writing a custom route constraint.

member.summary: Determines whether the URL parameter contains a valid value for this constraint.
member.param: An object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
The object that this constraint belongs to.
The name of the parameter that is being checked.
An object that contains the parameters for the URL.
An object that indicates whether the constraint check is being performed when an incoming request is being handled or when a URL is being generated.
member.returns: true if the URL parameter contains a valid value; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines whether the URL parameter contains a valid value for this constraint.
member.param: An object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
The name of the parameter that is being checked.
An object that contains the parameters for the URL.
indicates whether the constraint check is being performed when an incoming request is being handled or when a URL is being generated.
member.returns: true if the URL parameter contains a valid value; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Kentico.Web.Mvc.ApplicationBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods related to Kentico ASP.NET MVC integration features.
Provides extension methods related to Kentico ASP.NET MVC integration features.

member.name: M:Kentico.Web.Mvc.ApplicationBuilderExtensions.UseResourceSharingWithAdministration(Kentico.Web.Mvc.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary: When request is sent from administration domain of the site, adds header Access-Control-Allow-Origin into response to enable cross origin resource sharing (CORS) with the administration.

member.name: M:Kentico.Web.Mvc.ApplicationBuilderExtensions.UseDataAnnotationsLocalization(Kentico.Web.Mvc.IFeaturesBuilder)
member.summary: Enables localization of ASP.NET model meta-data based on data annotation attributes. Display names or validation results declared with data annotation attributes can contain keys of Kentico resource strings that will be resolved automatically using Kentico localization API. The localization uses a custom model metadata provider based on data annotations and is therefore not compatible with other providers or their customizations.

member.name: P:Kentico.Web.Mvc.CorsConfiguration.MaxAge

member.name: T:Kentico.Web.Mvc.AntiForgeryExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for AntiForgery support for pages with output cache.

member.name: M:Kentico.Web.Mvc.AntiForgeryExtensions.AntiForgeryToken(Kentico.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelperExtensionPoint)
member.summary: Generates a hidden form field (anti-forgery token) that is validated when the form is submitted.
member.remarks: Ensures that AntiForgery token is correctly generated on pages with output cache.

member.name: T:Kentico.Web.Mvc.AntiForgeryHelper
member.summary: Helper class used for AntiForgeryToken used on pages with output cache.

remarks.para: AntiForgery token for pages with output cache is ensured by combination of behavior and custom call of method within the response filtering. We can't use original method because the AntiForgery token is generated once and used for all responses, it means that different users have different cookie but same token in response which leads to validation error on form submit. Moreover, original method adds Set-Cookie into the headers so it's captured by output cache mechanism and output cache is not used on first request.

In case of not-cached response AntiForgery token in view is requested by method instead of . This method renders into the markup and registers response filter with placeholder replacement logic. The logic replaces the placeholder in response output and registers as validation callback with rendered token value (for cached response replacement). If AntiForgery cookie is not available the method sets the cookie but in this request pipeline stage the output cache is not disabled.

In case of cached response validation callback is initialized. Within the validation callback response filter is registered with AntiForgery token value replacement logic. We don't need to replace placeholder because placeholder is not in cached response the first token is cached in response. The token value is available in validation callback data object so we just replace the token value within the response filter replacement logic.

member.name: M:Kentico.Web.Mvc.AntiForgeryHelper.#ctor(System.Web.HttpContextBase,Kentico.Web.Mvc.Internal.ResponseFilter,System.Func{System.Web.HtmlString},CMS.Core.IEventLogService)
member.summary: Creates new instance of .

member.name: P:Kentico.Web.Mvc.AntiForgeryHelper.TokenReplacement
member.summary: Cached antiforgery token value to be replaced for cached response

member.summary: Request specific instance.

member.summary: Ensures modification for initial or cached request.
member.param: Indicates whether current request is initiated from cache.
